format.fText:
This program will demonstrate the major features of the vty-ui-builder tool. This program will take you through a series of interfaces which have been expressed in the vty-ui-builder input XML format.
The tool will generate a Haskell module with a default 'main' function which will set up key event handlers for each interface to allow you to evaluate each one as you are building your XML document.
Press the 'n' key whenever you want to change to the next demonstration interface (or 'p' to go to the previous one). In interfaces with multiple interactive widgets, press Tab to cycle focus between them.

format.fText: Widgets which ordinarily consume all available space can be constricted with a "limit" widget. Limit widgets place an upper bound on the limited dimension of a widget. To generate a limit widget, use vLimit (vertical limiting), hLimit (horizontal limiting), or boxLimit (both).

format.name: wrap
format.fText:
The size of a widget on the screen can be set to a specific value using a "fixed-size" widget. Fixed-size widgets place a constraint on the dimension of a widget. If the widget's actual size is less than the constraint, it is padded so that the space is always consumed. To generate a fixed-size widget, use vFixed (vertical fixed size), hFixed (horizontal fixed size), or boxFixed (both).
Fixed-size widgets are similar to "limit" widgets but guarantee that the size of the fixed widget will always remain constant, whereas limit widgets guarantee only an upper bound on size.
